title: I don't blame my team mates for losing, but sometimes...
body:
So I've always been big on focusing on my own mistakes and not playing the blame game in League. Even when someone on the enemy team blames one of their team mates, I purposely go out of my way to correct them. Sure certain unfortunate circumstances in games happen and you could most likely point at one champion as the cause, and, you might be correct. But I find that wasting your time blaming your team mates is pointless, it achieves nothing unless you're giving them advice along with it and you're being nice about it in general. My kinda mindset is, "It MIGHT'VE been that guys' fault, but I'm probably never gonna see or play with him again, so there's nothing I can do to fix his issues, so, what could I have done better?" and I find that to be really good.

But, sometimes, I can't. I just can't. This only happens to me very rarely, very very rarely, but in a game I played recently, I couldn't bring myself to NOT blame my team mates. I just literally could not find it in me and I just got so frustrated at them and it tilted me. Sure I didn't play perfectly, and of course I did look at what I could have done better, but I still couldn't even focus on that. Like this team was just, oh boy. And I tried to give them advice and tried to coach them a little, and I'm SUPER nice on the Rift to be completely honest, especially when talking to team mates but they just weren't listening.

Do you think it's fair to sometimes, even without saying it to your team mates, but just thinking to yourself, that your team is just bad this game. That's it, your team is horrendous and there's nothing you can do about it. Anyone?

replies.body: sometimes it is your teammates fault that you lost tbh. I've had a lot of games where 1 person has engaged at a bad time or got caught out or something and the enemy snowballed and won the game from that 1 person making a mistake.

It's the feeders and trolls that get me. I won't blame someone for having a bad game, but if you run into tower purposefully before minions even spawn or try to go support full AD TF then...
I'm getting mad just thinking about it.

Honestly the past few nights i've been in some horrid games of league with things between 3v5's

http://matchhistory.oce.leagueoflegends.com/en/#match-details/OC1/105716145/200474676?tab=overview

Games that have felt like bots

http://matchhistory.oce.leagueoflegends.com/en/#match-details/OC1/105714075/200474676?tab=overview

And games where one guy is just really toxic and doesn't even know what they are on about (Yasuo)

http://matchhistory.oce.leagueoflegends.com/en/#match-details/OC1/105769745/200474676?tab=overview

And honestly there are times where blame is avalible to other players, the main thing you have to do is realize you should be playing to better yourself, not playing to climb or playing to win, but playing to be able to play better.

It makes a lot of mistakes easier to look over when they come from your team mates.

There are always going to be those minute amount of games where your team are complete spastics that have no idea what they are doing, but RNGesus will speak and not place you with the idiots again (most likely) so putting up with them for one game should always be easy enough.

End note: Holidays make this game seem so much shittier.

Yeah I don't get it often. Even when my team mates make mistakes I can usually see they aren't retarded but pwoah some games man. But yeah I guess you're right, from bad games like that, the only way we can go is up!
